preface.title: Introduction
preface.para: Atomia Automation Server Manager is python-based command line application for managing Automation server accounts, packages and services. It contains most of the features of current Automation Server Client and allows making scripts that would do some batch operations in Automation Server (like adding/modifying/deleting bunch of services, installing the whole environment, once the Resource manager is ready, etc.) In future version(s) the Atomia Automation Server Manager will get its GUI part as well, which would be based on this command-line application.

section.title: Overview
section.para: The current version of Atomia Automation Server Manager supports account and account entities. The support for package entity will come in one of the next versions.

The Atomia Automation Server Manager is executed by running atomia.py python script. This script has -h switch, which prints out the available arguments:usage: atomia [-h] [--username USERNAME] [--password PASSWORD] [--api_url API_URL] [--account_number ACCOUNT_NUMBER] [--service_id SERVICE_ID] [--path PATH] [--service SERVICE] [--find_options FIND_OPTIONS] [--account ACCOUNT] entity action
Atomia Automation Server Manager
positional arguments: entity account|package|service action show|list|find|add|delete|modify
optional arguments: -h, --help show this help message and exit --username USERNAME The API user's username --password PASSWORD The API user's password --api_url API_URL The URL of the Automation Server API's wsdl --account_number ACCOUNT_NUMBER The account number in Automation Server; Required argument for all actions with service entity, show account and delete account. --service_id SERVICE_ID The string with logical id of the parent service (add|find service actions) or the given service (show|list|modify|delete service actions) --path PATH The JSON representation of the path to the parent service (add|find service actions) or the given service (show|list|modify|delete service actions) --service SERVICE Required argument when using add/modify service; Json representation of the service to be added/modified with possible keys: name(required when adding) and properties(required when adding or modifying --find_options FIND_OPTIONS Required argument when using find service, optional when using list accounts; Json object with possible keys: service_name, relative_path, service_properties, result_page, result_count --account ACCOUNT Required argument when adding account; Json object with possible keys: account_id, account_description, account_properties, provisioning_description
The order of the arguments is not important.

section.title: entity
section.para: entity argument specifies the type of Atomia Automation server entity that the action will be performed on. Can be one of three constant values: account, package or service.

section.title: action
section.para: action argument specifies the type of action that will be performed on the given Atomia Automation server entity. Can be one of these constant values: show, list, find, add, delete or modify.

section.title: account_number
section.para: account_number argument specifies the account number in the Automation server that the given entity belongs to. This argument is required for all actions with service entity, as well as show and delete account actions.

section.title: username
section.para: username argument specifies the username of the API user, used for Atomia Automation server API authentication/authorization. If omitted, the username will be taken from the configuration file named atomia.conf, located in the same folder as atomia.py or /etc directory.

section.title: password
section.para: password argument specifies the password of the API user, used for Atomia Automation server API authentication/authorization. If omitted, the password will be taken from the configuration file named atomia.conf, located in the same folder as atomia.py or /etc directory.

section.title: api_url
section.para: api_url argument specifies the location of the wsdl file of the Atomia Automation server API. If omitted, the url will be taken from the configuration file named atomia.conf, located in the same folder as atomia.py or /etc directory.

section.title: service_id
section.para:
service_id argument specifies the logical_id (GUID) of the parent service (add service and find service actions) or the given service (show service, list service, modify service and delete service actions).
--service_id "fa42f738-6533-4610-b8f5-9fa33aaaced2"

section.title: path
section.para:
path argument specifies the JSON representation (JSON array of objects) of the path to the parent service (add service and find service actions) or the given service (show service, list service, modify service and delete service actions).
--path "[{\"CsBase\" : \"d83805a8-c4a3-4e17-96af-4c9f0c1679d2\" }, {\"CsWindowsWebsite\" : {\"Hostname\":\"python43.org\"} } ]" As shown, each of the array elements is a key-value pair, where the value can either be service_id, or key-value pair of property names and values, respectively.

This example would find the CsWindows service in Automation server with the Hostname property set to "python43.org", located under the CsBase service with logical_id d83805a8-c4a3-4e17-96af-4c9f0c1679d2.

section.title: service
section.para: service argument is required with add service and modify service actions; for any other this argument is ignored. It is a JSON representation (key-value structure) of the service to be added or modified, with two possible keys: name and properties.
name key is used with add service action only - it's value is the string representing the name of the service to be added.
The value defined by the properties key is a key-value structure of service properties' names and values to be assigned to the service being added or modified.

section.title: find_options
section.para: find_options argument is required with find service action; for any other this argument is ignored. It is a JSON representation (key-value structure) of the additional required/optional arguments used with find service action, with the following keys:

orderedlist.para: service_name - required argument, defines the name of the service to search for
relative_path - required argument, defines the relative path from the parent service (slash-delimited string of service names)
service_properties - optional argument, defines the value(s) of the property(ies) of the service to match when searching for
result_page - optional argument, defines the page number of the paged results (0 by default)
result_count - optional argument, defines the number of items to return from the given paged results (100 by default)

section.title: account
section.para: account argument is required with add account action; for any other this argument is ignored. It is a JSON representation (key-value structure) of the account properties used when creating a new account, with the following keys:

orderedlist.para: account_id - required argument, defines the name of the new account in Atomia Automation server
account_description - optional argument, defines the description of the new account
account_properties - optional argument, defines the additional properties (key-value pairs) to be assigned to the new account

provisioning_description - optional argument, defines the name of the provisioning description to be assigned to the new account (if omitted, new account will get the default provisioning description in the Atomia Automation server)

section.title: Show service
section.para: The Show action of the service entity displays the service defined by service_id or path application arguments:atomia.py service show --account_number "101320" --service_id "fa42f738-6533-4610-b8f5-9fa33aaaced2"or atomia.py service show --account_number "101320" --path "[{\"CsBase\" : \"d83805a8-c4a3-4e17-96af-4c9f0c1679d2\" }, {\"CsWindowsWebsite\" : {\"Hostname\":\"python43.org\"} } ]" which results with:{ "status": "Ok", "logical_id": "c54a8e35-59ec-449a-b21d-c7053aec34e0", "provisioning_description": "ProvisioningDescription", "name": "CsWindowsWebsite", "current_request_id": "", "friendly_name": "IIS website complex service", "disabled": "false", "parent_id": "d83805a8-c4a3-4e17-96af-4c9f0c1679d2", "account_owner_id": "101321", "physical_id": "6669dc8b-974f-456c-94d7-88e185990072", "properties": [ { "is_key": "false", "property_type": "Integer", "id": "26629558", "prop_string_value": "gsB135.(", "name": "ADPassword" }, { "is_key": "false", "property_type": "Integer", "id": "26629559", "prop_string_value": "python43.org", "name": "DnsZone" }, { "is_key": "false", "property_type": "Integer", "id": "26629557", "prop_string_value": "", "name": "DomainPrefix" }, { "is_key": "false", "property_type": "Integer", "id": "26629560", "prop_string_value": "172.16.16.5", "name": "FtpResourceIp" }, { "is_key": "true", "property_type": "Integer", "id": "26629556", "prop_string_value": "python43.org", "name": "Hostname" }, { "is_key": "false", "property_type": "Integer", "id": "26629561", "prop_string_value": "", "name": "InfoEmailPassword" }, { "is_key": "false", "property_type": "Integer", "id": "26629563", "prop_string_value": "true", "name": "InitDns" }, { "is_key": "false", "property_type": "Integer", "id": "26629564", "prop_string_value": "true", "name": "InitEmail" }, { "is_key": "false", "property_type": "Integer", "id": "26629565", "prop_string_value": "v2.0", "name": "InitNetVersion" }, { "is_key": "false", "property_type": "Integer", "id": "26629562", "prop_string_value": "21", "name": "RootFolderParentPath" } ] }

section.title: List service
section.para: The List action of the service entity displays the list of child services for the given service defined by service_id or path application arguments:atomia.py service list --account_number "101321" --service_id "316c4640-9bef-4c50-ac1c-27e00b24d4e5"or atomia.py service show --account_number "101321" --path "[{\"CsDatabase\" : \"ac83b69a-61fe-4a9a-ac1b-5eefa9153a22\" }, {\"CsMySqlDatabase\" : \"316c4640-9bef-4c50-ac1c-27e00b24d4e5\" } ]"which results with:[ { "status": "Ok", "logical_id": "314cc1bc-c1c8-4344-b764-bf11f921a07d", "provisioning_description": "ProvisioningDescription", "name": "DnsZone", "current_request_id": "", "friendly_name": "DNS Zone", "disabled": "false", "account_owner_id": "101321", "physical_id": "f3eec488-0d5a-4533-8037-bbab8d6c97d8", "properties": [ { "is_key": "false", "property_type": "Integer", "id": "26630431", "prop_string_value": "1209600", "name": "Expire" }, { "is_key": "false", "property_type": "Integer", "id": "26630434", "prop_string_value": "false", "name": "IsReverse" }, { "is_key": "false", "property_type": "Integer", "id": "26630432", "prop_string_value": "1209600", "name": "Minimum" }, { "is_key": "false", "property_type": "Integer", "id": "26630427", "prop_string_value": "ns1.int.atomia.com.", "name": "Mname" }, { "is_key": "false", "property_type": "Integer", "id": "26630429", "prop_string_value": "1200", "name": "Refresh" }, { "is_key": "false", "property_type": "Integer", "id": "26630430", "prop_string_value": "180", "name": "Retry" }, { "is_key": "false", "property_type": "Integer", "id": "26630428", "prop_string_value": "registry.int.atomia.com.", "name": "Rname" }, { "is_key": "false", "property_type": "Integer", "id": "26630433", "prop_string_value": "true", "name": "Shared" }, { "is_key": "true", "property_type": "Integer", "id": "26630425", "prop_string_value": "mysql.int.atomia.com", "name": "Zonename" }, { "is_key": "false", "property_type": "Integer", "id": "26630426", "prop_string_value": "3600", "name": "Zonettl" } ] }, { "status": "Ok", "logical_id": "1fdf5a73-4edc-4ae6-b00d-7c18ba302eff", "provisioning_description": "ProvisioningDescription", "name": "MySQLDatabase", "current_request_id": "", "friendly_name": "MySQL Database", "disabled": "false", "account_owner_id": "101321", "physical_id": "95b1a3d3-6401-40a5-8786-71b6b9e5f65c", "properties": [ { "is_key": "false", "property_type": "Integer", "id": "26630423", "prop_string_value": "utf8", "name": "CharacterSet" }, { "is_key": "false", "property_type": "Integer", "id": "26630424", "prop_string_value": "utf8_unicode_ci", "name": "Collation" }, { "is_key": "true", "property_type": "Integer", "id": "26630422", "prop_string_value": "101321-testpy", "name": "DatabaseName" } ] } ]

section.title: Find service
section.para: The Find action of the service entity displays the list of services found for the given parent service defined by service_id or path and the given options target service(s) must comply with, defined by find_options argument.

The following command would find all ApacheWebSite services under the service with logical_id d83805a8-c4a3-4e17-96af-4c9f0c1679d2, with CsLinuxWebsite in between (relative path from d83805a8-c4a3-4e17-96af-4c9f0c1679d2 to ApacheWebSite) - all ApacheWebSite services under all CsLinuxWebsite services under the service with logical_id d83805a8-c4a3-4e17-96af-4c9f0c1679d2:

On the other hand, the following command would find all DnsZoneRecord services under root, with CsBase/CsWindowsWebsite/DnsZone in between (relative path from root to DnsZoneRecord) - all DnsZoneRecords under all DnsZone services under all CsWindowsWebsite services under all CsBase services:

section.title: Add service
section.para: The Add action of the service entity adds a new service to the Atomia Automation server, defined by the service argument, under the parent service defined by service_id or path application arguments:atomia.py service add --account_number "101321" --service_id "b1568e33-14de-4c35-bb46-84009248c0d2" --service "{ \"name\" : \"CsMySqlDatabase\", \"properties\" : { \"DatabaseName\" : \"testpy45\", \"CharacterSet\" : \"utf8\", \"Collation\" : \"utf8_general_ci\"}}"which results with:{ "status": "Ok", "logical_id": "4d518781-978c-4bff-8472-cef9d49c4c9b", "provisioning_description": "ProvisioningDescription", "name": "CsMySqlDatabase", "current_request_id": "", "friendly_name": "MySQL Databasee Complex Service", "disabled": "false", "parent_id": "b1568e33-14de-4c35-bb46-84009248c0d2", "account_owner_id": "101321", "physical_id": "1dc1431d-b494-4dcc-9fe4-475a2332d888", "properties": [ { "is_key": "false", "property_type": "Integer", "id": "26631046", "prop_string_value": "utf8", "name": "CharacterSet" }, { "is_key": "false", "property_type": "Integer", "id": "26631047", "prop_string_value": "utf8_general_ci", "name": "Collation" }, { "is_key": "true", "property_type": "Integer", "id": "26631045", "prop_string_value": "testpy45", "name": "DatabaseName" } ] }

section.title: Modify service
section.para: The Modify action of the service entity modifies the service defined by service_id or path application arguments with the new property value(s), specified in the service argument arguments:atomia.py service modify --account_number "101321" --service_id "4d518781-978c-4bff-8472-cef9d49c4c9b" --service "{ \"properties\" : { \"Collation\" : \"utf8_unicode_ci\"}}"which results with:{ "status": "Ok", "logical_id": "4d518781-978c-4bff-8472-cef9d49c4c9b", "provisioning_description": "ProvisioningDescription", "name": "CsMySqlDatabase", "current_request_id": "", "friendly_name": "MySQL Databasee Complex Service", "disabled": "false", "parent_id": "b1568e33-14de-4c35-bb46-84009248c0d2", "account_owner_id": "101321", "physical_id": "1dc1431d-b494-4dcc-9fe4-475a2332d888", "properties": [ { "is_key": "false", "property_type": "Integer", "id": "26631046", "prop_string_value": "utf8", "name": "CharacterSet" }, { "is_key": "false", "property_type": "Integer", "id": "26631047", "prop_string_value": "utf8_unicode_ci", "name": "Collation" }, { "is_key": "true", "property_type": "Integer", "id": "26631045", "prop_string_value": "testpy45", "name": "DatabaseName" } ] }

section.title: Delete service
section.para: The Delete action of the service entity deletes the service defined by service_id or path from the Atomia Automation server:atomia.py service delete --account_number "101321" --service_id "4d518781-978c-4bff-8472-cef9d49c4c9b"which results with:Deleted service 4d518781-978c-4bff-8472-cef9d49c4c9b successfully.

section.title: List account
Show account
Add account
Delete account
section.para: The Delete action of the account entity deletes the account from Atomia Automation server, defined by account_number argument (which is required here):atomia.py account delete --account_number "atomia001"which results with:Deleted account atomia001 successfully.
